keyword: how many calories in a bean burrito at taco bell
title: How Many Calories in a Taco Bell Bean Burrito?
meta_description: Discover how many calories in a bean burrito at Taco Bell—about 350 kcal—plus full nutrition breakdown, macros, and tweaks for variations.
h1: How Many Calories in a Taco Bell Bean Burrito?
assumptions: Standard Taco Bell Bean Burrito with refried beans, cheese, onions, red sauce, and flour tortilla; as prepared in restaurant.
disclaimer: Nutrition varies by location, preparation, portion size, and customizations. Check Taco Bell's official app or site for latest values.

quick_answer.text: A Taco Bell bean burrito contains 350 calories and 13 g protein.

label_note: Totals mirror Nutrition Facts fields for easy comparison.

tweaks.label: Fresco style (swap cheese/sauce for pico de gallo)

faqs.q: How many calories in a bean burrito at Taco Bell?
faqs.a: Approximately 350 kcal for one standard bean burrito.

faqs.q: What's the protein in a Taco Bell bean burrito?
faqs.a: About 13 g of protein per burrito.

faqs.q: Are Taco Bell bean burritos high in sodium?
faqs.a: Yes, around 1060 mg sodium per burrito due to beans and sauce.

faqs.q: How many carbs in a Taco Bell bean burrito?
faqs.a: Roughly 50 g carbs, including 7 g fiber from the tortilla and beans.

faqs.q: Can I customize a Taco Bell bean burrito for fewer calories?
faqs.a: Yes, opt for fresco style or skip cheese to reduce calories by up to 80.
